title: 108_hr3767
content: The Medicare Prescription Drug Savings and Choice Act of 2004 establishes a Medicare operated prescription drug plan option under the Social Security Act. The Medicare Prescription Drug Savings and Choice Act of 2004 establishes a Medicare operated prescription drug plan option under the Social Security Act. Starting in 2006, the Secretary will offer one or more Medicare operated prescription drug plans with a nationwide service area and negotiate with pharmaceutical manufacturers to reduce drug costs for eligible individuals. The Secretary will also promote the use of more affordable therapeutic equivalents. The Medicare Prescription Drug Savings and Choice Act of 2004 establishes a Medicare operated prescription drug plan option under the Social Security Act. The plan offers qualified prescription drug coverage and access to negotiated prices. Monthly beneficiary premiums for qualified prescription drug coverage are defined. The monthly beneficiary premium for qualified prescription drug coverage under a Medicare operated prescription drug plan shall be uniform nationally, starting at $35 in 2006 and adjusted based on average costs in succeeding years. The Secretary may adjust the premium for supplemental prescription drug coverage. There is a requirement for at least one plan with a $35 premium. The Secretary must ensure that at least one Medicare operated prescription drug plan in 2006 has a $35 monthly premium. The Secretary may designate a Medicare operated prescription drug plan as the fallback plan for certain service areas. The Secretary may designate a Medicare operated prescription drug plan as the fallback plan for certain service areas. Section 1860D-13(c)(3) of the Act is amended to include Medicare operated prescription drug plans. Section 1860D-16(b)(1) of the Act is also amended to specify payments for expenses incurred. The amendments made by this section relate to Medicare operated prescription drug plans under the Medicare Prescription Drug, Improvement, and Modernization Act of 2003. The term 'medicare operated prescription drug plan' is defined in section 1860D-11A(c). The effective date of these amendments is retroactive to the enactment of the mentioned Act.
